message.content:
cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.CV. 

The paper presents a novel intrinsically motivated agent that learns how to control the environment in the fastest possible manner by optimizing learning progress. This involves learning what can be controlled, how to allocate time and attention, and the relations between objects using surprise-based motivation. The paper also demonstrates the effectiveness of the method in a synthetic as well as a robotic manipulation environment. Based on this, the most likely sub-categories are cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.RO (Robotics). Additionally, the paper involves learning from scratch, which is a common theme in the sub-category cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also involves task planning, which is a common theme in the sub-category cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the paper involves manipulation environments, which is a common theme in the sub-category cs.CV (Computer Vision).
